items.title: Arnaud Martiny - Portfolio
items.description: The very site you are currently browsing! A modern portfolio designed to showcase my projects and skills, featuring custom CSS/JS animations and a fully responsive layout. The ultimate meta-project, and a true sandbox for experimentation.

caseStudy.title: C:\Projects\Portfolio_Meta.exe
caseStudy.brief: The objective was to design a portfolio that would be much more than just an online resume. It had to act as a true demonstration of my skills in front-end development, interaction design, and animation. The challenge was to create an immersive and memorable experience, coded entirely in "vanilla" (without major frameworks like React or Vue) to prove a fundamental mastery of web technologies.
caseStudy.role: As the sole developer on this "meta" project, I took on all the roles: information architect, UX/UI designer to conceive each section, and front-end developer to write every line of code. The approach was "mobile-first" to ensure perfect responsiveness. Special care was given to performance optimization and creating a robust internationalization (i18n) system for a global reach.
caseStudy.tools: Languages: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+) Animation: GSAP (GreenSock Animation Platform) for all complex interactions and smooth transitions. Design: Figma for prototyping and mockup design. Internationalization (i18n): Custom-built system based on reading JSON files for a fully bilingual site. Tools: Git & GitHub for versioning.

items.title: Fast 'N Friends
items.imageAlt: Preview of the Fast N Friends project
items.description: A student carpooling website developed in PHP with WordPress as its CMS. This project was an excellent opportunity to learn user profile management, responsiveness, and database fundamentals on the fly.

caseStudy.title: C:\Projects\FastNFriends_Platform.exe
caseStudy.brief: The challenge for this academic project, carried out as a two-person team, was to build a 100% functional web platform for student carpooling. The specifications required complete user management (registration, login), a system for posting trip ads, and an efficient search engine, all based on a custom-designed relational database.
caseStudy.role: As a co-developer, I took a 'full-stack' approach. My responsibilities covered the entire project lifecycle: writing the specifications, project management, and designing the UI/UX in Figma. On the technical side, I developed the WordPress theme from scratch, with no pre-made templates. This included front-end development for an intuitive user experience and back-end programming in PHP/SQL to automate all critical modules: profiles, sessions, trip posting, and search.
caseStudy.tools: Languages: PHP, SQL, CSS3, HTML5 CMS: WordPress (100% Custom Theme) Database: MySQL Design & Prototyping: Figma Project Management: Specification writing, team collaboration.
